newsitem.title: PERU: Newmont to trade shrs in Lima next week.
newsitem.headline: Newmont to trade shrs in Lima next week.

text.p: Newmont Mining Corp, which operates South America's largest gold mine, Yanacocha, will begin trading shares on the Lima Stock Exchange next week, the bolsa said Friday.
"The register will be from May 26 and the shares can be traded 72 hours after the register," the exchange said in its daily report.

Market officials said Newmont had registered 99.3 million shares on the Lima market with a nominal value of $1.60 each. Preferential shares held by majority shareholders will have a nominal value of $5.00, they added.
Newmont had announced its intention last year to list shares on the local market, saying it was justified by the firm's large presence in Peru through Yanacocha.
Newmont has a 51.35 percent stake in Yanacocha, a joint venture with local firm Cia. Minera Buenaventura SA, which has a 43.65 percent stake.
It will be the third company to trade simultaneously in New York and Lima after Holding Credicorp and Southern Peru Copper Corp.
